channel.title: Dave Winer's linkblog
channel.description: This has been in existence in one form or another for many years. Now it's being edited in FeedLand using a bookmarklet.

item.description: With WordPress competing with Substack in email newsletters we should now be able to work around Substack’s insistence that writers must use their editor. WordPress has a simple API making that kind of lock-in impossible.
item.source:markdown: With WordPress competing with Substack in email newsletters we should now be able to work around Substack’s insistence that writers must use their editor. WordPress has a simple API making that kind of lock-in impossible.

item.description: 30 Non-Trivial Ways for Developers to Use GPT-4.
item.source:markdown: 30 Non-Trivial Ways for Developers to Use GPT-4.

item.description: Twitter not removing hateful posts from subscribed users, study finds.
item.source:markdown: Twitter not removing hateful posts from subscribed users, study finds.

item.description: I'm starting to post links to Masto on Twitter, and links to Twitter on Bluesky. All combos. I realized I was, in my mind, assuming these were silos. That's not a good limit to impose, doesn't work in our interests, as users and developers.
item.source:markdown: I'm starting to post links to Masto on Twitter, and links to Twitter on Bluesky. All combos. I realized I was, in my mind, assuming these were silos. That's not a good limit to impose, doesn't work in our interests, as users and developers.

item.description: Spam is one thing, but spam that assumes I have a living father is another altogether.
item.source:markdown: Spam is one thing, but spam that assumes I have a living father is another altogether.

item.description: Twitter requires organizations to pay to be verified. It actually makes sense. This was a service they previously provided for free, but they were not a profitable company. Other companies should share in the expense.
item.source:markdown: Twitter requires organizations to pay to be verified. It actually makes sense. This was a service they previously provided for free, but they were not a profitable company. Other companies should share in the expense.

item.description: After Calling Joe Biden Senile, GOPers Complain He Outsmarted Them.

item.description: My first fat tweet. I've only been begging for this for over a decade. Now give us optional titles, styles, links, enclosures.
item.source:markdown: My first fat tweet. I've only been begging for this for over a decade. Now give us optional titles, styles, links, enclosures.

item.description: Karl, about Tom: “You’re a clumsy interloper and no one trusts you. The only guy pulling for you is dead. And now, you’re just married to the ex-boss’ daughter, and she doesn’t even like you. And you are fair and squarely fucked.”
item.source:markdown: Karl, about Tom: “You’re a clumsy interloper and no one trusts you. The only guy pulling for you is dead. And now, you’re just married to the ex-boss’ daughter, and she doesn’t even like you. And you are fair and squarely fucked.”

item.title: Bluesky People Browser
item.description: I'm playing with ideas of how to browse around a network of followers on a social media platform. Bluesky is the first that I've had an OPML interface to work with. So I created an outliner for walking the structure of people and who they follow on Bluesky.
item.source:markdown: I'm playing with ideas of how to browse around a network of followers on a social media platform. Bluesky is the first that I've had an OPML interface to work with. So I created an outliner for walking the structure of people and who they follow on Bluesky.

item.description: A nice thing about Bluesky is that everyone has about the same small number of followers, which suggests that perhaps follower count should not be in the UI. Wondering what other features turn up the heat too much and should be similarly treated.
item.source:markdown: A nice thing about Bluesky is that everyone has about the same small number of followers, which suggests that perhaps follower count should not be in the UI. Wondering what other features turn up the heat too much and should be similarly treated.

item.description: It might not be possible to de-Nazify social nets like Twitter, Mastodon or Bluesky -- yet that seems to be what users want.
item.source:markdown: It might not be possible to de-Nazify social nets like Twitter, Mastodon or Bluesky -- yet that seems to be what users want.

item.description: WordPress first shipped 20 years ago today. Thanks for keeping the blogging flame going, and thanks for supporting RSS and the open web. 😀
item.source:markdown: WordPress first shipped 20 years ago today. Thanks for keeping the blogging flame going, and thanks for supporting RSS and the open web. 😀

item.description: This is what a linkblog looked like in 2011. Remarkable how no progress has been made in all this time. We were pretty much blocked in every direction.
item.source:markdown: This is what a linkblog looked like in 2011\. Remarkable how no progress has been made in all this time. We were pretty much blocked in every direction.

item.description: We're going to have to figure out moderation for ourselves. Waiting for the tech companies to figure this out -- they are very limited as we have learned.
item.source:markdown: We're going to have to figure out moderation for ourselves. Waiting for the tech companies to figure this out -- they are very limited as we have learned.

item.description: A house for sale on the Hudson River. Thought people reading my linkblog might find this interesting. 😀
item.source:markdown: A house for sale on the Hudson River. Thought people reading my linkblog might find this interesting. 😀
